title: Københavns Idræts Forening
text:
Københavns Idræts Forening (abbreviated Københavns IF, KIF) is a <a href="Denmark">Danish</a> <a href="Track%20and%20field%20athletics">athletics</a> club based in the <a href="%C3%98sterbro">Østerbro</a> district of <a href="Copenhagen">Copenhagen</a>.
The club is based at the <a href="%C3%98sterbro%20Stadium">Østerbro Stadium</a> and the indoor <a href="Club%20Danmark%20Hallen">Club Danmark Hallen</a> in <a href="Valby">Valby</a>. The club was founded in 1892 as "Københavns Fodsports-Forening"—the club adopted its current name in 1914—and is Denmark's oldest athletics club.
37 members of Københavns Idræts Forening have competed at the <a href="Olympic%20Games">Olympic Games</a>. <a href="Niels%20Holst-S%C3%B8rensen">Niels Holst-Sørensen</a>, one of the club's athletes, won a gold medal in the <a href="400%20metres">400 metres</a> at the <a href="1946%20European%20Athletics%20Championships">1946 European Athletics Championships</a> in <a href="Oslo">Oslo</a>. <a href="Gunnar%20Nielsen%20%28athlete%29">Gunnar Nielsen</a> another of the club's athletes was 1955 <a href="1500%20metres%20world%20record%20progression">world record holder at 1500 metres</a> with 3.40.8.
By the time of its centenary in 1992, the club's members had won a total of 575 gold medals at the Danish championships—the club is second only to <a href="Sparta%20%28Athletic%20club%29">Sparta</a> in the number of Danish champions that it has produced.
